title: Typewriter font from 1964
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725075246im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typewriter_5332.jpg)

I'm typesetting some letters from 1964. I'm hoping to identify the type used in this sample. I'm specifically interested in the number set.

thanks!
author: Fiver

comments.content:
You may like:  
 **[Pica 10 pitch](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725075246/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/pica-10-pitch/)** from Bitstream  
or you can look at the dafont typewriter category for a more "deteriorated" look like:  
 **[Typewriter Font ( Royal 200)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725075246/http:/www.dafont.com/typewriter-royal-20.font?text=on+Friday%2C+September+4th+July%2C+1964.+%2C+25+Push&psize=s)** by Mike Larsson [2004, Free for personal use]

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725075246im_/http:/typophile.com/files/UnderWoodChampionByVicFieger_4341.jpg)
  
Available from dafont [http://www.dafont.com/underwood-champion.font?text=on+Friday%2C+Septembe...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725075246/http:/www.dafont.com/underwood-champion.font?text=on+Friday%2C+September+4th+July%2C+1964.+25 "http://www.dafont.com/underwood-champion.font?text=on+Friday%2C+September+4th+July%2C+1964.+25")  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725075246im_/http:/typophile.com/files/myunderwood2_6199.jpg)
  
Many substitutes, but these are the only matches.  
Don
